description._content: Title: Judge Thomas J. Devine Creator: Callaway Date: ca. 1880s Part Of: Lawrence T. Jones III Texas photography collection Place: San Antonio, Bexar County, Texas Description: Thomas Jefferson Devine (18201890), an eminent Texas jurist and Confederate diplomat, served as Associate Justice on the Texas Supreme Court, 1874-1875. After receiving his degree and license to practice, Devine moved to La Grange, Texas, married, and settled in San Antonio in 1844 where he opened a law practice. Devine was appointed San Antonio city attorney and served until 1851, when he was elected district judge of the Bexar district until 1861. He was a member of the Secession Convention in 1861 and served as a member of the Public Safety Committee that supervised the surrender of federal troops, supplies, and property in Texas. He was appointed judge of the Confederate Western District of Texas. After the Civil War, he was charged with high treason and imprisoned but later pardoned in 1867. In 1874, he was appointed as associate justice of the Texas Supreme Court but resigned the following year. From 1881 to 1882, Devine served on the board of regents for the University of Texas, which opened in 1883. (Handbook of Texas) Physical Description: 1 print on cabinet card mount; 16.5 x 10.5 cm. File: ag2008_0005_3_2_163_c_devine_opt.jpg Rights: Please cite Southern Methodist University, Central University Libraries, DeGolyer Library when using this image file. A high-quality version of this file may be obtained for a fee by contacting degolyer@smu.edu. For more information, see: digitalcollections.smu.edu/u?/jtx,3630 View Lawrence T. Jones III Texas Photographs: digitalcollections.smu.edu/all/cul/jtx/
